content.body: shu you may be interested in this thread on liveness on es-discourse: https://es.discourse.group/t/liveness-barriers-and-finalization/1082/
content.formatted_body: shu you may be interested in this thread on liveness on es-discourse: https://es.discourse.group/t/liveness-barriers-and-finalization/1082/

content.body: interesting
felix wants a portable liveness fence
i don't think that exists
(for the reasons that they point out, basically)
well let me think about it some more
one probably does exist for any given program (and a closed world assumption)
but i'm not sure one exists for all implementations for all given programs
* but i'm not sure one exists for all implementations for all given programs

m.new_content.body: but i'm not sure one exists for all implementations for all given programs

content.body:
> <@shuyuguo:matrix.org> one probably does exist for any given program (and a closed world assumption)

Using `eval` to try and disable all optimisations would be cheating right?..
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @shuyuguo:matrix.org
one probably does exist for any given program (and a closed world assumption)
Using eval to try and disable all optimisations would be cheating right?..

content.body: `new WeakRef(obj)` actually is a liveness fence, by my reading
content.formatted_body: new WeakRef(obj) actually is a liveness fence, by my reading

content.body: since it adds `obj` to `KeptAlive`
well, for one turn
oh, like, constantly creating new WeakRefs?
in practice i agree that is a fence
but we hung all of this on observability which we also agreed to be too hard to pin down
if the `new WeakRef(obj)` itself is unobservable, i'd imagine its effects to also be up for as-if DCE
content.formatted_body: if the new WeakRef(obj) itself is unobservable, i'd imagine its effects to also be up for as-if DCE

content.body: (though in practice of course nobody does that)
i guess it's not that the `new WeakRef(obj)` would be unobservable, but whether the [[KeptAlive]] addition is unobservable
content.formatted_body: i guess it's not that the new WeakRef(obj) would be unobservable, but whether the [[KeptAlive]] addition is unobservable

content.body: right, and it is in fact observable, because addition to [[KeptAlive]] prevents collecting on the current turn
* right, and it is in fact observable, because addition to [[KeptAlive]] prevents collecting on the current turn

m.new_content.body: right, and it is in fact observable, because addition to [[KeptAlive]] prevents collecting on the current turn

content.body: i think there are cases that could be unobservable, but only theoretically
